page.title: 17SPORT AND LEISURE IN PENNARD
page.content: INDOOR SPORTS CLUBS MEET IN THE COMMUNITY CENTRE. PENNARD INDOOR BOWLS CLUB WITH SEVENTY-FOUR MEMBERS HOLDS THREE SESSIONS WEEKLY, WHILE SOUTHGATE ARCHERY CLUB, WITH FORTY-THREE MEMBERS USES THE INDOOR RANGE TWICE A WEEK DURING THE WINTER AND AN OUTDOOR RANGE IN THE SUMMER. THERE ARE SIX SEPARATE BADMINTON GROUPS, CATERING FOR SEVENTY-FIVE PLAYERS, HOLDING SIX SESSIONS A WEEK. OUTDOOR SPORTS ARE PLAYED ON THE COMMUNITY PLAYING FIELD. SOUTHGATE COUNTY FOOTBALL CLUB HAS TWENTY-EIGHT MEMBERS, WHILE THE CRICKET CLUB HAS TWENTY-TWO. THE SCHOOL PARENTS ASSOCIATION NUMBERS TWO HUNDRED. FUNCTIONS INCLUDE TALKS, DANCES AND CAR RALLIES. THE GARDEN SOCIETY MEETS MONTHLY. APART FROM TALKS AND EXCHANGE OF EXPERTISE, VISITS TO LOCAL GARDENS AND FLOWER SHOWS, IT STAGES ITS OWN ANNUAL SHOW.
